TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit JsonPropertyInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides JSON serialization-related metadata about a property or field.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Reflection::ICustomAttributeProvider ^ AttributeProvider { System::Reflection::ICustomAttributeProvider ^ get(); void set(System::Reflection::ICustomAttributeProvider ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the custom attribute provider for the current property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
When resolving metadata via <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver>, this property will be populated with the underlying <xref:System.Reflection.MemberInfo> of the serialized property or field.
Setting a custom attribute provider has no impact on the contract model but serves as metadata for downstream contract modifiers.

Docs.exception: The instance has been locked for further modification.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Text::Json::Serialization::JsonConverter ^ CustomConverter { System::Text::Json::Serialization::JsonConverter ^ get(); void set(System::Text::Json::Serialization::JsonConverter ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom converter override for the current property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
It is possible to use <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonConverterFactory> instances with this property.
For contracts originating from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver>, the value of <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonPropertyInfo.CustomConverter> will be mapped from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonConverterAttribute> annotations.

Docs.exception: The instance has been locked for further modification.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a getter delegate for the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Setting to `null` will result in the property being skipped on serialization.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.IsExtensionData : bool with get, set
public: property bool IsExtensionData { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current property is a special extension data property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For contracts originating from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver> or <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerContext>, the value of this property will be mapped from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonExtensionDataAttribute> annotations.

Docs.exception:
The instance has been locked for further modification.
-or-
The current is not valid for use with extension data.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.IsRequired : bool with get, set
public: property bool IsRequired { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current property is required for deserialization to be successful.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For contracts that originate from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver> or <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerContext>, the value of this property is mapped from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonRequiredAttribute> annotations.
For contracts that use <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver>, the value of this property is also mapped from properties that have the `required` modifier, unless deserialization uses a constructor that populates all required properties and has <xref:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.SetsRequiredMembersAttribute>.
The `required` keyword is currently not supported in <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerContext> contracts.

Docs.exception: The instance has been locked for further modification.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Name : string with get, set
public: property System::String ^ Name { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the JSON property name used when serializing the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The value of <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonPropertyInfo.Name> cannot conflict with that of other <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonPropertyInfo> defined in the declaring <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfo>.
For contracts originating from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver> or <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonSerializerContext>, the value typically reflects the underlying .NET member name, the name derived from <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.PropertyNamingPolicy>, or the value specified in <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonPropertyNameAttribute>.

Docs.exception: The instance has been locked for further modification.

MemberSignature.Value: .property instance class System.Func`3<object, object, bool> ShouldSerialize
Public Property ShouldSerialize As Func(Of Object, Object, Boolean)
member this.ShouldSerialize : Func<obj, obj, bool> with get, set

public: property Func<System::Object ^, System::Object ^, bool> ^ ShouldSerialize { Func<System::Object ^, System::Object ^, bool> ^ get(); void set(Func<System::Object ^, System::Object ^, bool> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a predicate that determines whether the current property value should be serialized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The first parameter denotes the parent object, and the second parameter denotes the property value.
Setting the predicate to `null` is equivalent to always serializing the property value.
For contracts originating from <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.DefaultJsonTypeInfoResolver>, the value of <xref:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonIgnoreAttribute.Condition> will map to this predicate.

Docs.exception: The instance has been locked for further modification.
